Rest in a dark, quiet room. Use OTC pain relievers and stay hydrated. Consult a doctor for frequent migraines.

Use clean compresses and avoid touching eyes. Consult a doctor for prescription eye drops.

Eat high-fiber foods (apples, oats, broccoli) and prunes. Drink warm water with lemon. Avoid processed foods.
Eat soft foods: warm soup, mashed potatoes, yogurt, or honey in tea. Avoid citrus and spicy foods.
Eat oatmeal, ginger, or almonds. Avoid citrus, chocolate, fried foods, and large meals before bed.

Focus on potassium-rich foods: bananas, sweet potatoes, and leafy greens. Avoid salt, processed meats, and canned soups.
Eat magnesium-rich foods: almonds, spinach, and avocados. Avoid aged cheese, processed meats, and alcohol.
Eat garlic, citrus fruits, and chicken soup. Stay hydrated with herbal teas. Avoid sugary drinks.

For a cold, eat garlic, citrus fruits, chicken soup, and drink herbal teas. Avoid sugary drinks and dairy if congested.
For diabetes, focus on low-glycemic foods like whole grains, leafy greens, and nuts. Avoid sugary snacks, refined carbs, and sweetened beverages.
For high blood pressure, eat potassium-rich foods like bananas, spinach, and sweet potatoes. Avoid salty snacks, processed meats, and canned soups.
For anemia, eat iron-rich foods like spinach, lentils, and red meat. Pair with vitamin C sources (oranges, bell peppers) to boost absorption.
For acid reflux, eat oatmeal, ginger, and non-citrus fruits. Avoid spicy foods, chocolate, caffeine, and large meals before bed.
For arthritis, eat anti-inflammatory foods like fatty fish (salmon), turmeric, and berries. Avoid fried foods and refined sugars.
For migraines, eat magnesium-rich foods like almonds, spinach, and avocados. Avoid aged cheeses, processed meats, and alcohol.
For diabetes, choose low-glycemic foods like quinoa, leafy greens, and nuts. Avoid sugary snacks, white bread, and sweetened drinks.
For high cholesterol, eat oats, fatty fish (salmon), and walnuts. Avoid trans fats (fried foods) and limit red meat.
For IBS, try a low-FODMAP diet: zucchini, carrots, and gluten-free grains. Avoid beans, garlic, and dairy if lactose intolerant.
For hypothyroidism, eat selenium-rich foods (Brazil nuts, tuna) and iodine sources (seaweed). Avoid raw cruciferous vegetables (kale, broccoli).
For PCOS, focus on high-fiber foods (berries, lentils) and lean proteins. Avoid refined carbs and sugary drinks.
For gout, eat cherries, low-fat dairy, and whole grains. Avoid organ meats, shellfish, and alcohol.
For fatty liver, eat leafy greens, green tea, and olive oil. Avoid alcohol, sugary snacks, and fried foods.
For osteoporosis, prioritize calcium (dairy, fortified plant milk) and vitamin D (eggs, mushrooms). Limit caffeine and soda.
For depression, eat omega-3-rich foods (salmon, flaxseeds) and folate sources (spinach, avocado). Avoid processed foods.
During pregnancy, eat folate-rich foods (lentils, spinach), iron (lean meat), and calcium (yogurt). Avoid raw fish and unpasteurized cheese.
For kidney stones, drink plenty of water, eat citrus fruits, and limit sodium. Avoid spinach, nuts, and processed meats.
For gluten sensitivity, choose gluten-free grains (quinoa, rice) and fresh produce. Avoid wheat, barley, and processed foods with hidden gluten.
